item.title: Signals not operating correctly, 12th January
item.description:
The pedestrian and cycle crossings do not work correctly. 1. They fail to detect cyclists in both directions requiring them either to press the pedestrian buttons which are not situated for cyclist use or cross the road without traffic control and the associated risk. 2. For pedestrians, the lights take too long to change after being pressed. Having timed them them this can be in excess of 3 minutes and changed when the main lights across London road were green causing static traffic. The alternative which most pedestrian adopt is too cross the road without signal control. Resolution is to reset the cycle and pedestrian detectors to make sure they work and secondly to reset the delay to a more appropriate period
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large quantity of mud on road, 12th January
item.description:
Following recent bad weather and floods, there is a large quantity of mud on the road and paths at the entrance to Blacksmith Lane, please could it be cleaned up and removed. Previously reported and marked a complete but it’s not!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Blacksmiths Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A number of drains are blocked with leaves and rubbish along the road between 22b Olb Bath road and the junction with Sandford mill lane on both sides of the road., 12th January
item.description:
Due to reduced street cleaning a number of drains are fully covered over with old leaves and rubbish. The gutters need to be cleared on both the East and West sides of the road between London Road and the junction with Sandford Mill Lane. The drains then also need to be cleared properly to allow flow.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Old Bath Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Warning of bridge closure from two sources stating different times. I (and a handful of others) live within the area being closed and just need some ACCURATE information to plan., 12th January
item.description:
Bridge on Pirton Lane crossing Golden Valley. ⬇️ post with official Glos Council letter says day time closure. https://www.facebook.com/share/p/1XyVQhsKja/?mibextid=wwXIfr ⬇️ post by Glos Roads is overnight closure. https://www.facebook.com/share/p/1BCj7fxh5H/?mibextid=wwXIfr And the photo of roadside communication says overnight. Is it a case of left and right hand not working together OR is it both? I live within the closed zone and am unsure if my driveway will be accessible during the closures.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 8 inch pot hole approx on road outside 103 welch road, 12th January
item.description:
Outside 103 welch road. Road has been like this for at least 6 months. Road is heavily used by large vehicles including buses. every time a large vehicle hits the pothole a large bang is heard and the whole house shakes. this has been reported months ago but nothing has been done. Please fix.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Welch Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
